meanings.definition: (verb) to slip or fall out of place
meanings.sent1: The book prolapsed from the shelf and landed on the floor.
meanings.sent2: I saw a leaf prolapsed from the tree during the windy storm.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy made the sock prolapsed from the laundry basket.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence prolapsed when she forgot her lines on stage.
meanings.sent5: The balloon prolapsed slowly, losing air with a soft hiss.

meanings.definition: (adjective) having slipped or fallen out of place
meanings.sent1: The prolapsed disc in his back caused him great pain.
meanings.sent2: The prolapsed cable dangled dangerously from the ceiling.
meanings.sent3: The prolapsed sock made the laundry pile look messy.
meanings.sent4: Her prolapsed umbrella turned inside out in the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The prolapsed curtain revealed a peek of the garden outside.

meanings.definition: (noun) a slipping or falling out of place
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed her with a prolapsed organ that needed surgery.
meanings.sent2: The prolapsed of the painting from the wall surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The prolapsed of the puzzle piece made it hard to complete the picture.
meanings.sent4: The prolapsed of the bridge caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent5: The prolapsed of the bookshelf led to a messy room.
